meaning: The mass per unit volume of a material, usually in kg/m^3.
The model of matter that represents the arrangement and movement of particles in a substance.
A dense state in which particles are uniformly arranged and vibrate around fixed positions.
A fairly dense state in which particles are free to move around, and fit the shape of their container.
A sparse state in which particles move freely in constant random motion. Can be compressed or expanded.
Energy stored inside a system by the particles that make up the system; the total kinetic energy and potential energy of all particles in the system.
The amount of energy required to raise the temperature of one kilogram of a substance by one degree Celsius.
The amount of energy required to change the state of one kilogram of the substance without a change in temperature.
The amount of energy required for a change of state from solid to liquid.
The amount of energy required for a chnage of state from liquid to vapour.
THe transfer of energy by a force
A change of state from solid to liquid.
A change of state from liquid to solid.
A change of state from liquid to gas
A change of state from gas to liquid.
A change of state between gas and solid, without passing through the liquid phase.
